titleStmt.title: Unto all judges, jurors, witnesses and seamen, or any other who have been, are, or may be exercised in making laws against the innocent, or in trying, judging, or carrying-out of their native country such innocent persons as in conscience towards God cannot stoop to the wills of men, in conforming to their laws made against the witness of God in all clean conscience.

Unto all judges, jurors, witnesses and seamen, or any other who have been, are, or may be exercised in making laws against the innocent, or in trying, judging, or carrying-out of their native country such innocent persons as in conscience towards God cannot stoop to the wills of men, in conforming to their laws made against the witness of God in all clean conscience.
titleStmt.author: May, Thomas, fl. 1664.
Kirkby, William, fl. 1664.
Lloyd, John, fl. 1665.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing (2nd. ed.).
Variously signed: (first part) William Kirkby, (second part) Thomas May, (third part) John Lloyd, Thomas Hughes, Thomas Moody [and 5 others]
Reproduction of original in: Friends' Library (London, England).
